# Onkwehonwehneha Program Development, Ontario Region

## Project Overview

The Correctional Services Canada is seeking a supplier to develop the Onkwehonwehneha Program, a vocational rehabilitation service aimed at supporting Indigenous offender reintegration in the Ontario region.

## Project Description

This project involves the development of targeted interventions to support Indigenous offender reintegration in remote communities. The project objectives include:

* Enhancing the Correctional Services Canada's ability to return Indigenous offenders to their home communities with Section 84 release plans
* Increasing the capacity to engage Indigenous communities in the Section 84 process and identify community resources for offenders

## Key Responsibilities

The successful supplier will be responsible for:

* Providing community education and information about Section 84 and Section 81 of the Corrections and Conditional Release Act (CCRA)
* Identifying resources and community contacts that can be used by Correctional Services Canada personnel when preparing release plans
* Working with communities and organizations to establish a process for Correctional Services Canada engagement on corrections
* Providing information to support the development of Section 84 release plans

## Expected Outcomes

The expected outcomes of this project include:

* Increased culturally specific offender reintegration support
* Increased community awareness of Section 84 of the Corrections and Conditional Release Act (CCRA) and the Indigenous Continuum of Care within Correctional Services Canada
* Identifying and developing community resources such as housing, counseling, employment, education, and other resources that can be utilized to support offenders on a conditional release plan

## Criteria for Assessment of Statement of Capabilities

The following criteria will be used to assess the statement of capabilities submitted by suppliers:

* Experience: At least 3 years of experience in Indigenous service delivery and providing Indigenous based support and social services to Indigenous community members
* Ability to work in English

## Procurement Details

This procurement is set-aside for Indigenous suppliers under the Government Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business. The proposed contract is for a period of one (1) year from April 8, 2024 – March 31, 2025 with an option to extend the contract for two (2) additional one (1) year periods. The estimated value of the contract, including options, is $288,081.00 (GST/HST extra).
